titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice Television and Video Production records, 1999-2013 UA 406
titlestmt.author: Claudia Middleton

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:42:58 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice Television and Video Production records
did.abstract: These records include the creative output of the Rice Television and Video Production organization, which comprises student events and original programming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: While the start date is unclear, Rice Broadcast Television [RBT] began original programming on October 29, 1998 with a topical news show focused on worldwide and Rice news stories. In that year, RBT received funding from the Vice President of Student Affairs office. In March 1999, RBT became a blanket tax student organization.
RBT continued in this way until April 2005 when it changed its name to Rice Television 5 [RTV5].

In Fall 2015, RTV5's leadership changed the club's name to Rice Video Productions [RVP]. Since they avoided going through the Student Association for this re-brand, they almost lost their funding access during a general election referendum. On January 23, 2017, RVP requested to no longer receive Blanket Tax Committee funding, because they considered that their mission included filming student events, but also original programming. The Student Association respected RVP's request and dissolved funding on January 30th.
RVP's YouTube shows that the group continued to upload content to the social media network, with the last group of videos uploaded on February 25, 2017.
Over its lifespan, the club mainly filmed events for other clubs and student events like Lunar New Year, Soul Night, and Beer Bike. It also dabbled at different times in original programming.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: These records include the creative output of the Rice Television and Video Production organization, which comprises student events and original programming. There are a variety of formats including DVDs, VHS, and digital videocassettes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research. Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred to the Woodson Research Center on 2017-06-28 by Kelley Callaway.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice Television and Video Production records, 1999-2013, UA 409, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files are .wav, .avi, and .mpg on DVD. Disc titles include: "Windsync: First Half"; "Mixed Media"; "CBI Video Awards"; "VODS"; "Supershorts, Life on the Street, Runaway Bride, Small Room, KRM Pickle Shell World"; "Supershorts, Life on the Street, Runaway Bride, Small Room, KRM Pickle Shell World"; "POSADA"; "Battle o' Bands"; "KSDS Dances with Owls"; "President's Study Break"; "Greenscreen Time with Nico"; "Greenscreen: Leebron/Forman Get Rickrolled"

scopecontent.p: These files are unknown file types. Disc titles include: "Greenscreen Madness"; "Winds in Tights (1/2)"; "Winds in Tights (2/2)"; "Satin Hooks - KTRU Concert"; "Liberty Live"; "ENZO Spokesperson, Kyle Lee Music"; "Must play on DVD player"; "Richard, Luke (1/2)"; "Richard; Luke (2/2)"; "Mr. Plow Live"; "Price"
